page.title: 01Farmland around Pitcaple
page.content: A main road, railway and river run almost parallel through SW corner which has many trees, a castle (sometimes open to the public), P.O., shop, craftshop and filling station. The Aberdeen-Elgin bus service passes daily. The village nearby consists of council housing scheme (some bought now by former tenants) two new housing estates - private bungalows - and bigger houses. Housing - one third council, just under half private, one fifth farm. Apart from council-owned quarry, farm and aboretum, the rest of the land is farmed, more crop than beasts. the B9001, on which a limited bus service runs, traverses area from south-west corner to central north. Undulating terrain makes an interesting landscape, you suddenly lose a landmark that you know is just over the knoll.
